title: What is the history of the phrase 'to be clear'? - Quora
tags: Etymology of English Phrases (Origin or History of English Phrases)

response.answer_text: I would guess that it comes from various sorts of competitive race, where faster racers have people in front of them, until they get well ahead. Another possibility is "clear of debt". Or even "clearing a harbour" - a ship getting past the other shipping and various look-out points etc.
